meanings.definition: Having only one end or side different from the other.
meanings.sent1: The caterpillar had a hemimorphic pattern on its back, with one side darker than the other.
meanings.sent2: The artist created a hemimorphic painting, where one corner was bright red while the rest was in shades of gray.
meanings.sent3: The hemimorphic cake had one half covered in chocolate and the other half in vanilla frosting.
meanings.sent4: Her hemimorphic hairstyle featured one side with curls and the other side straight.
meanings.sent5: The hemimorphic flower had petals of different sizes on each side, creating a unique look.

meanings.definition: Describing a crystal form that is asymmetrical on opposite sides.
meanings.sent1: The hemimorphic crystal had a smooth surface on one side and rough edges on the other.
meanings.sent2: The geologist found a hemimorphic rock sample, with one side reflecting light differently than the rest.
meanings.sent3: The hemimorphic gemstone sparkled on one side but looked dull on the other.
meanings.sent4: The hemimorphic diamond refracted light in a mesmerizing way, showcasing its unique structure.
meanings.sent5: The hemimorphic crystal glowed softly on one side, creating a beautiful contrast with the other side.
